newsitem.title: MALAYSIA: Malaysia Repco sells gaming unit.
newsitem.headline: Malaysia Repco sells gaming unit.

text.p: Repco Holdings Bhd has agreed to sell its gaming subsidiary, Everise Ventures Sdn Bhd for 500 million ringgit in cash.
The gaming firm will be sold to Glowblitz Amalgamated Sdn Bhd, a unit of Rekapacific Bhd, Repco said in a statement.
Everise Ventures operates lottery services in Borneo state of Sabah.
Repco also said it has agreed to acquire a 49 percent equity interest in Jernih Karya Sdn Bhd for 21.56 million ringgit in cash.
Jernih Kaya holds a 49 percent stake in Dioncorp Sdn Bhd which has obtained approval to set up a new stockbroking firm in Sabah.

Repco has also entered into a timber supply agreement with Pembinaan YCS Bhd, whereby YCS will seek to purchase all its timber and timber-related requirements from Repco for its construction projects.

Repco said the corporate exercises were part of its long term strategy to diversify from the gaming sector and into the financial services industry, as well as strengthening its timber division's move into further downstream timber processing and marketing.
The disposal of Everise Ventures will result in an extraordinary profit of about 342 million ringgit, it said.
Repco shares were suspended since July 14 at the company's request. The stock was last traded at 138 ringgit.
